Class FindPeaks

  • java.lang.Object
    • FindPeaks
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ij.gui.DialogListener, ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

    public class FindPeaks
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter, ij.gui.DialogListener
    ImageJ plugin to find peaks (maxima) in vertical sections of a z-stack
    Author:
    thomasbraschler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean doFiltering
      Octave's findpeak function works in two parts: primary peak detection, and then filtering according to various criteria to reject local maxima that do not satisfy the quality criteria This variable indicates whether this filtering step should be done (true) or not (false)
      protected ij.ImagePlus imp
      Holds a reference to the primary ImagePlus object associated with this plugin
      protected ij.process.ImageProcessor ip
      image processor at the time of starting the analysis
      static double maxW
      Maximum width, in pixels, in the z-direction.
      static double minD
      Minimal distance, in pixels, in the z-direction.
      static double minH
      Minimum height, in intensity units, above the background level.
      static double minW
      Minimal width, in pixels, in the z-direction.
      static double peak_fraction
      Expected fraction of pixels above the threshold to be set and thus to be eligible for being a peak

      • Fields inherited from interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

        CONVERT_TO_FLOAT, DOES_16, DOES_32, DOES_8C, DOES_8G, DOES_ALL, DOES_RGB, DOES_STACKS, DONE, FINAL_PROCESSING, KEEP_THRESHOLD, NO_CHANGES, NO_IMAGE_REQUIRED, NO_UNDO, PARALLELIZE_IMAGES, PARALLELIZE_STACKS, ROI_REQUIRED, SNAPSHOT, STACK_REQUIRED, SUPPORTS_MASKING

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FindPeaks()

      Read the peak_fraction, minD, doFiltering, minW, maxW and minH parameters from the dialog
      boolean doDialog()
      Displays the dialog with the various findPeaks options
      int[] findPeaksInSection(int x, int y)
      Finds the indexes of the peaks in the z-Profile at a given xy position
      int[] getStackSection(int x, int y)
      Get the pixel values along the z direction in a stack, at a horizontal location specified by x and y
      void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor theIp)
      Displays the dialog for setting the custom options.
      int setup(java.lang.String arg, ij.ImagePlus imp)
      Indicate that we need greyscale images and also that the original image is not changed ( a new output image is generated instead)

    • Field Detail

      • imp

        protected ij.ImagePlus imp
        Holds a reference to the primary ImagePlus object associated with this plugin

      • ip

        protected ij.process.ImageProcessor ip
        image processor at the time of starting the analysis

      • peak_fraction

        public static double peak_fraction
        Expected fraction of pixels above the threshold to be set and thus to be eligible for being a peak

      • minD

        public static double minD
        Minimal distance, in pixels, in the z-direction. This is the minD argument to the Octave function findPeaks

      • minW

        public static double minW
        Minimal width, in pixels, in the z-direction. This is the minW argument to the Octave function findPeaks

      • maxW

        public static double maxW
        Maximum width, in pixels, in the z-direction. This is the maxW argument to the Octave function findPeaks

      • minH

        public static double minH
        Minimum height, in intensity units, above the background level. This is the minH of the Octave function findPeaks, but is interpreted as being the difference to background

      • doFiltering

        public static boolean doFiltering
        Octave's findpeak function works in two parts: primary peak detection, and then filtering according to various criteria to reject local maxima that do not satisfy the quality criteria This variable indicates whether this filtering step should be done (true) or not (false)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FindPeaks

        public FindPeaks()

    • Method Detail

      • dialogItemChanged

        public boolean dialogItemChanged(ij.gui.GenericDialog gd,
                                 java.awt.AWTEvent e)
        Read the peak_fraction, minD, doFiltering, minW, maxW and minH parameters from the dialog
        Specified by:
        dialogItemChanged in interface ij.gui.DialogListener

      • setup

        public int setup(java.lang.String arg,
                 ij.ImagePlus imp)
        Indicate that we need greyscale images and also that the original image is not changed ( a new output image is generated instead)
        Specified by:
        setup in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

      • getStackSection

        public int[] getStackSection(int x,
                             int y)
        Get the pixel values along the z direction in a stack, at a horizontal location specified by x and y
        Parameters:
        x - x-position in pixel units, 0-based (ImageJ standard)
        y - y-position in pixel units, 0-based (ImageJ standard)
        Returns:
        Pixel values along the z-profile

      • run

        public void run(ij.process.ImageProcessor theIp)
        Displays the dialog for setting the custom options. Then finds the temporal peaks with these options for each xy pixel position. Output: creates and shows a new stack with identical dimensions to the stack analyzed, where non-peak pixels are black (0) and peak pixels white (255)
        Specified by:
        run in interface ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

      • findPeaksInSection

        public int[] findPeaksInSection(int x,
                                int y)
        Finds the indexes of the peaks in the z-Profile at a given xy position
        Parameters:
        x - x-position in pixel units, 0-based (ImageJ standard)
        y - y-position in pixel units, 0-based (ImageJ standard)
        Returns:
        Array of peak positions (pixel units, 0-based) in the z-profile

      • doDialog

        public boolean doDialog()
        Displays the dialog with the various findPeaks options
        Returns:
        true upon success, false otherwise (including user cancel)
